intro: Ibidium beckii, commonly known as the Beck's ibidium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
